notesStmt.note: Paper fixed in numerous places with silk gauze.

Missing, damaged parts are supplied by a later hand. His colophon is on folio 151v: נשלם תקון זה התאג’ .. שנת ב’ אלפים ומאה וארבעין שנין לשטרי במאתא כיואן .. והמתקן חתכי [=סאלם בא"ת ב"ש] בן כבוד אבא מנחם בן סעדיה.
Catalogue of Hebrew Manuscripts in the Gaster Collection, the British Library, London (London: Hebrew Section. Oriental and India Office Collection, 1996).

msContents.summary: The Pentateuch, with vowel-points and accents, accompanied by masorah magna and parva, in two volumes.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script of the 15th century., punctuated Probably written by the same scribe as Oxford, Bodleian MS. Oppenheim Add. 4° 97a. The latter was written by Yosef ben Benayah in 1478 (colophon on folio 315v).

binding.p: In-house, half-bound. Spine: 'Pentateuch. Hebrew. II. Brit. Mus. Oriental 9886.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Gaster (b. 1856, d. 1939), scholar and rabbi: his manuscript, Cod. G. 325: inscribed with his name (folios 1r, 151v); purchased by the British Museum from him on 12 April, 1924: inscribed (back flyleaf [ii]v).
